On Friday 16 July 2004 01:39 am, kk_oop wrote:
>  --- In junit@yahoogroups.=
com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
>  > kk_oop wrote:
>  > > Hi=
.=A0 I was running a test suite under JUnit version 3.7.0 through
>  > > XD=
E/Eclipse version 2.0.1 and I got a null pointer error.=A0 When I
>  > > st=
epped through the program, I saw that the error occurs right when I
>  > > =
get a window telling me
>  > > that "org.eclipse.jdt.runner.RemoteTestRunne=
r" type cannot be found.
>  > > Do I need this type?=A0 It does not seem to=
 be in the junit.jar file.
>  >
>  > It sounds like you need it. It's part =
of the Eclipse JUnit integration.
>  > --
>
>  Do you know where it is supp=
osed to be?=A0 I'm not sure if it's not
>  there, or if it is there and Ecl=
ipse just isn't seeing it.

You only need the source for it if you want to =
step through/into it.  However, 
it's quite likely that the NullPointer is =
not in the RemoteTestRunner.  I 
have used the Eclipse JUnit integration si=
nce ~2001 and have not run into 
problems like this in the runner (at least=
 not that I can recall).  It's more 
likely that the error is in your code =
and is being masked.  I would advise 
setting some strategic breakpoints an=
d stepping through your test code.  
However, if you really want the source=
 to the plugin, you can find out how to 
check it out of CVS here: http://d=
ev.eclipse.org/cvshowto.html
